user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtMem2BinFileCmp:
```c
bool UtMem2BinFileCmp(const void *Memory, const char *Filename)
{
    FILE *       fp;
    const uint8 *MemByte = Memory;
    int          FileByte;
    bool         Success;
    uint32       i;

    Success = true;
    if ((fp = fopen(Filename, "r")))
    {
        for (i = 0; (FileByte = fgetc(fp)) != EOF; i++)
        {
            if (MemByte[i] != FileByte)
            {
                Success = false;
                printf("UtMem2BinFileCmp: Miscompare in file: %s, byte offset: %lu, expected: %u, found: %u\n",
                       Filename, (unsigned long)i, (unsigned int)MemByte[i], (unsigned int)FileByte);
                break;
            }
        }
        fclose(fp);
    }
    else
    {
        Success = false;
        printf("UtMem2BinFileCmp: Error Opening File: %s, %s\n", Filename, strerror(errno));
        UtAssert_True(false, "UtMem2BinFileCmp: Error Opening File");
    }

    return Success;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function UtMem2BinFileCmp:
UtAssert_CaseType_t UtAssert_GetContext(void)
{
    return DefaultContext;
}
...
#define UtAssert_True(Expression, __VA_ARGS__) UtAssertEx(Expression,UtAssert_GetContext(),__FILE__,__LINE__,__VA_ARGS__)
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
UtAssert_CaseType_t UtAssert_GetContext(void)
{
    return DefaultContext;
}

```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: UtAssert_GetContext simply returns a variable (DefaultContext) and performs no function calls, so it neither directly nor indirectly calls itself. (A hypothetical violation would occur if UtAssert_GetContext called UtAssert_True or UtAssertEx while those functions/macros in turn call UtAssert_GetContext, creating indirect recursion.)
